intro: Pterota tragodes, commonly known as the common lichen moth, is a species of moth that belongs to the family Erebidae. It is characterized by its distinctive wing patterns, which often feature intricate designs in shades of brown and gray. The larvae of this species feed on a variety of plants, including shrubs and trees, contributing to the ecological balance of forest ecosystems. The plant-associated life cycle of Pterota tragodes highlights its role in the interactions between insects and vegetation. Its presence is often an indicator of healthy, undisturbed habitats.
